Assessments_v2_attemptResult.title: AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner - Practice Exam (CLF-C01) - 5

domainGradeBreakdown.domainDescription: This represents exam questions for the Cloud Computing section.
This represents exam questions for the Security & Compliance section.
This represents exam questions for the Technology section.
This represents exam questions for the Billing & Pricing section.

questions.questionText: A fantasy sports company needs to run an application for the length of a football season (5 months). They will run the application on an EC2 instance and there can be no interruption. Which purchasing option best suits this use case?

choices.explanation: This is not a long enough term to make Reserved Instances the better option. Plus, the application can't be interrupted, which rules out Spot Instances.
Dedicated Instances provide the option to bring along existing software licenses. The scenario does not indicate a need to do this.
This is not a long enough term to make reserved instances the best option.
The scenario states there can be no interruption, so Spot Instances are not a viable option.

correctAnswers.explanation: This is not a long enough term to make Reserved Instances the better option. Plus, the application can't be interrupted, which rules out Spot Instances.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are valid ways for an IAM user to manage AWS resources?

choices.explanation: The 2 types of access are AWS Management Console access and programmatic access. Programmatic access is available via the AWS API, the CLI, and the SDKs - and an IAM user can use all these methods.

choices.text: Emergency access via Identity and Access Management (IAM)
choices.explanation: Emergency access is not a feature of IAM.
The two types of access are AWS Management Console access and programmatic access. Programmatic access is available via the AWS API, the CLI, and the SDKs - and an IAM user can use all these methods.

choices.text: Security group access via the AWS command line
choices.explanation: Security groups control network traffic to EC2 instances and do not provide access to managing AWS resources.

choices.text: Programmatic access via the command line
choices.explanation: The 2 types of access are AWS Management Console access and programmatic access. Programmatic access is available via the AWS API, the CLI, and the SDKs - and an IAM user can use all these methods.

correctAnswers.explanation: The 2 types of access are AWS Management Console access and programmatic access. Programmatic access is available via the AWS API, the CLI, and the SDKs - and an IAM user can use all these methods.
The two types of access are AWS Management Console access and programmatic access. Programmatic access is available via the AWS API, the CLI, and the SDKs - and an IAM user can use all these methods.

correctAnswers.text: Programmatic access via the command line
correctAnswers.explanation: The 2 types of access are AWS Management Console access and programmatic access. Programmatic access is available via the AWS API, the CLI, and the SDKs - and an IAM user can use all these methods.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.text: Emergency access via Identity and Access Management (IAM)
incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Emergency access is not a feature of IAM.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.text: Security group access via the AWS command line
incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Security groups control network traffic to EC2 instances and do not provide access to managing AWS resources.

questions.questionText: In the AWS Global Infrastructure, which components are physically separated and connected through low-latency links, enabling fault tolerance and high availability?

choices.explanation: Availability Zones (AZs) are connected among themselves in a single Region. They are physically separated, connected through low-latency links, fault tolerant, and allow high availability.

Amazon Route 53 is a highly available and scalable cloud Domain Name System (DNS) web service. It is designed to give developers and businesses an extremely reliable and cost-effective way to route end users to internet applications by translating names (like *www.example.com*) into the numeric IP addresses (like 192.0.2.1) that computers use to connect to each other. Amazon Route 53 is fully compliant with IPv6 as well.
https://aws.amazon.com/route53/

VPC is a foundational service that allows you to create a secure private network in the AWS Cloud where you launch your resources.
https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/
A Region is a geographic location. Regions are fully independent and isolated as well as resource- and service-specific. Regions contain Availability Zones (AZs).

correctAnswers.explanation: Availability Zones (AZs) are connected among themselves in a single Region. They are physically separated, connected through low-latency links, fault tolerant, and allow high availability.

questions.questionText: What are the 3 cloud computing models?

choices.explanation:
SaaS is 1 of the 3 cloud computing models.

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/types-of-cloud-computing.html
FaaS describes a service that allows you to execute code in response to events. AWS Lambda is a good example of this.

PaaS is 1 of the 3 cloud computing models.

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/types-of-cloud-computing.html

IaaS is 1 of the 3 cloud computing models.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/types-of-cloud-computing.html

correctAnswers.explanation:
SaaS is 1 of the 3 cloud computing models.

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/types-of-cloud-computing.html

PaaS is 1 of the 3 cloud computing models.

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/types-of-cloud-computing.html

IaaS is 1 of the 3 cloud computing models.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/types-of-cloud-computing.html

questions.questionText: Which of the following is correct regarding the number of Regions, Availability Zones, edge locations, and data centers?

choices.text: There are more Availability Zones than edge locations.
choices.explanation: There are many more edge locations than Availability Zones.

choices.text: There are more edge locations than Availability Zones.
choices.explanation:
Edge locations are a part of AWS' content distribution network and are separate from Regions and AZs. The number of edge locations around the world is greater than that of Regions and Availability Zones, in order to reduce latency between your content and your customers - the more that exist, the greater the chance there is 1 where you need it.
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/?p=ngi&loc=2

choices.text: The number of Availability Zones is the same as the number of edge locations.
choices.explanation: There are many more edge locations than Availability Zones.

choices.text: There are more Regions than edge locations.
choices.explanation: There are many more edge locations than Regions.

correctAnswers.text: There are more edge locations than Availability Zones.
correctAnswers.explanation:
Edge locations are a part of AWS' content distribution network and are separate from Regions and AZs. The number of edge locations around the world is greater than that of Regions and Availability Zones, in order to reduce latency between your content and your customers - the more that exist, the greater the chance there is 1 where you need it.
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/?p=ngi&loc=2

questions.questionText: For enhanced technical support, some AWS Support plans enable you to have an unlimited number of contacts that can open an unlimited amount of cases. Which of the following choices offer this feature?

choices.explanation: The Developer plan does not offer this feature.

With either the Business or Enterprise support plans, you can have an unlimited number of contacts that can open an unlimited amount of cases.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/
The Basic plan does not offer this feature.

With either the Business or Enterprise support plans, you can have an unlimited number of contacts that can open an unlimited amount of cases.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

correctAnswers.explanation:
With either the Business or Enterprise support plans, you can have an unlimited number of contacts that can open an unlimited amount of cases.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

With either the Business or Enterprise support plans, you can have an unlimited number of contacts that can open an unlimited amount of cases.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

questions.questionText: Which of the following can be used as a web-based interface to access and manage the AWS cloud?

choices.explanation: Amazon API Gateway is an AWS service for creating, publishing, maintaining, monitoring, and securing REST, HTTP, and WebSocket APIs at any scale.
The AWS CLI is the command line interface and enables interaction with AWS from the command line in a terminal.
AWS Management Console is a web application for accessing and managing Amazon Web Services. AWS Documentation: [AWS Management Console](https://aws.amazon.com/console/).
The SDK (software development kit) allows programmatic interaction with AWS.

correctAnswers.explanation: AWS Management Console is a web application for accessing and managing Amazon Web Services. AWS Documentation: [AWS Management Console](https://aws.amazon.com/console/).

questions.questionText: Your design team has recommended the need to distribute incoming traffic across multiple EC2 instances and also across multiple Availability Zones. Which AWS service can accomplish this?

choices.explanation:
CloudFront is a CDN that delivers data and applications globally with low latency.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudfront/
CloudFormation allows you to provision AWS resources using Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
An Auto Scaling group creates and manages scaling out and scaling in the EC2 instances, but it does not handle the distribution of traffic to those instances.

Elastic Load Balancing automatically distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets, such as Amazon EC2 instances.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/

correctAnswers.explanation:
Elastic Load Balancing automatically distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets, such as Amazon EC2 instances.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/

questions.questionText: You have a short-term computing task to complete. It is essential that this task run uninterrupted from start to finish. Which is the best EC2 option for this task?

choices.explanation:
The process needs to run uninterrupted from start to finish. This eliminates Spot Instances.
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/

It is a short-term project, which rules out Reserved Instances, and it has to run uninterrupted, which rules out Spot Instances.
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/

The use of Dedicated Hosts is primarily for using existing software licenses. There is not enough information in the scenario to draw this conclusion.
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/

The scenario needs a short-term project. Reserved Instances require a longer term commitment (1 or 3 years).
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/

correctAnswers.explanation:
It is a short-term project, which rules out Reserved Instances, and it has to run uninterrupted, which rules out Spot Instances.
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/

questions.questionText: What can you do using AWS Budgets?

choices.text: Track costs associated with your account and choose to be alerted when expenditures exceed your fixed target amount
choices.explanation:
According to AWS, "You can use AWS Budgets to set a monthly cost budget with a fixed target amount to track all costs associated with your account. You can choose to be alerted for both actual (after accruing) and forecasted (before accruing) spends."

AWS Documentation: [Managing your costs with AWS Budgets](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cost-management/latest/userguide/budgets-managing-costs.html).

choices.text: Visualize, understand, and manage your AWS costs and usage over time
choices.explanation:
According to AWS, "AWS Cost Explorer has an easy-to-use interface that lets you visualize, understand, and manage your AWS costs and usage over time."

AWS Documentation: [AWS Cost Explorer](https://aws.amazon.com/aws-cost-management/aws-cost-explorer/).

choices.text: Organize and track the costs of your AWS resources on a detailed level
choices.explanation:
According to AWS, "You can use cost allocation tags to organize your AWS resources, and cost allocation tags to track your AWS costs on a detailed level."

AWS Documentation: [Using Cost Allocation Tags](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsaccountbilling/latest/aboutv2/cost-alloc-tags.html).

choices.text: Create a report with the most comprehensive set of cost and usage data available for your AWS account
choices.explanation:
According to AWS, "The AWS Cost and Usage Reports (AWS CUR) contains the most comprehensive set of cost and usage data available." 

AWS Documentation: [What are AWS Cost and Usage Reports?](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cur/latest/userguide/what-is-cur.html).

correctAnswers.text: Track costs associated with your account and choose to be alerted when expenditures exceed your fixed target amount
correctAnswers.explanation:
According to AWS, "You can use AWS Budgets to set a monthly cost budget with a fixed target amount to track all costs associated with your account. You can choose to be alerted for both actual (after accruing) and forecasted (before accruing) spends."

AWS Documentation: [Managing your costs with AWS Budgets](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cost-management/latest/userguide/budgets-managing-costs.html).

questions.questionText: You want to define a secure private network in an AWS account where you launch your resources. What do you need to configure?

choices.explanation:
VPC is a foundational service that allows you to create a secure private network in the AWS Cloud where you launch your resources.
https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/

An internet gateway allows public traffic to the internet from a VPC.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/VPC_Internet_Gateway.html
A VPN creates a secure connection between your internal networks and your AWS VPCs. A VPN is used to connect to a VPC that already has resources launched.

AWS Organizations allows you to centrally manage multiple AWS accounts under 1 umbrella. This is unrelated to defining a secure private network.
https://aws.amazon.com/organizations/

correctAnswers.explanation:
VPC is a foundational service that allows you to create a secure private network in the AWS Cloud where you launch your resources.
https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: A VPN creates a secure connection between your internal networks and your AWS VPCs. A VPN is used to connect to a VPC that already has resources launched.

questions.questionText: You added a recently hired HR Assistant to the IAM group named 'HumanResources'. Which of the following statements will apply to that user?

choices.text: The HR Assistant inherits the permissions of the 'HumanResources' group.
choices.explanation:
By adding the HR Assistant to the 'HumanResources' group using the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service, the new hire is now a member of the company’s HR department and inherits the administrative permissions of that group.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/getting-started_create-admin-group.html

choices.text: The HR Assistant becomes an IAM member of the company’s Human Resources department.
choices.explanation:
By adding the HR Assistant to the 'HumanResources' group using the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service, the new hire is now a member of the company’s HR department and inherits the administrative permissions of that group.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/getting-started_create-admin-group.html

choices.text: The HR Assistant becomes leader of the Human Resources department.
choices.explanation: This is not possible via IAM.

choices.text: The HR Assistant becomes the AWS root account user.
choices.explanation: A user can be assigned administrative access, but not root user access.

correctAnswers.text: The HR Assistant inherits the permissions of the 'HumanResources' group.
correctAnswers.explanation:
By adding the HR Assistant to the 'HumanResources' group using the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service, the new hire is now a member of the company’s HR department and inherits the administrative permissions of that group.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/getting-started_create-admin-group.html

correctAnswers.text: The HR Assistant becomes an IAM member of the company’s Human Resources department.
correctAnswers.explanation:
By adding the HR Assistant to the 'HumanResources' group using the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service, the new hire is now a member of the company’s HR department and inherits the administrative permissions of that group.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/getting-started_create-admin-group.html

questions.questionText: You need to store key-value pairs of users and their high scores for a gaming application. Which is the fastest and cheapest storage option for this type of data?

choices.explanation: RedShift is for data warehousing and suited for storing much larger datasets than what is described in this scenario.

DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL key-value and document database. DynamoDB scales automatically to massive workloads with fast performance and is the best choice for this scenario.
https://aws.amazon.com/dynamodb/
Although this can be done, there is a better and faster option for storing this type of data.
Amazon S3 is better suited for storing objects than searchable key-value pairs.

correctAnswers.explanation:
DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL key-value and document database. DynamoDB scales automatically to massive workloads with fast performance and is the best choice for this scenario.
https://aws.amazon.com/dynamodb/

questions.questionText: What is the most efficient way for a customer to continuously monitor CloudTrail event logs, Amazon VPC Flow Logs, and DNS logs looking for unauthorized behavior?

choices.explanation: While a CloudWatch alarm can be created to monitor logs, like VPC Flow Logs, it is not the most efficient way.

GuardDuty is an intelligent threat detection system
that uncovers unauthorized behavior.
Config allows you to assess, audit, and evaluate the configurations of your resources.
Inspector works with EC2 instances to uncover and report vulnerabilities.

correctAnswers.explanation:
GuardDuty is an intelligent threat detection system
that uncovers unauthorized behavior.

questions.questionText: You want to monitor the cost of using your AWS services and receive alerts when the thresholds you define are met. Which of the following AWS Budgets types should you create?

choices.explanation: This type of budget is not the best choice.

You need to create a cost budget with AWS Budgets if you want to monitor the cost of using your AWS services.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsaccountbilling/latest/aboutv2/budgets-managing-costs.html
This type of budget is not the best choice.
This type of budget is not the best choice.

correctAnswers.explanation:
You need to create a cost budget with AWS Budgets if you want to monitor the cost of using your AWS services.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsaccountbilling/latest/aboutv2/budgets-managing-costs.html

questions.questionText: You need to use an AWS service to assess software vulnerabilities and unintended network exposure of your Amazon EC2 instances. Which of the following services should you use?

choices.explanation:
AWS Trusted Advisor inspects your AWS environment and makes recommendations for saving money, improving system performance, or closing security gaps. 
Reference: [AWS Trusted Advisor](https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/faqs/?nc=sn&loc=6#AWS_Trusted_Advisor)

Amazon Inspector is an automated vulnerability management service that continually scans Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) and container workloads for software vulnerabilities and unintended network exposure. 
Reference: [Amazon Inspector FAQs](https://aws.amazon.com/inspector/faqs)

AWS WAF is a web application firewall that helps protect web applications from attacks by allowing you to configure rules that allow, block, or monitor (count) web requests based on conditions that you define. These conditions include IP addresses, HTTP headers, HTTP body, URI strings, SQL injection, and cross-site scripting. 
Reference: [AWS WAF FAQs](https://aws.amazon.com/waf/faqs/)

AWS Shield is a managed service that provides protection against Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks for applications running on AWS. 
Reference: [AWS Shield FAQs](https://aws.amazon.com/shield/faqs/)

correctAnswers.explanation:
Amazon Inspector is an automated vulnerability management service that continually scans Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) and container workloads for software vulnerabilities and unintended network exposure. 
Reference: [Amazon Inspector FAQs](https://aws.amazon.com/inspector/faqs)

questions.questionText: A company runs workloads in the cloud with unknown and dynamic user demand. Which usage features make the cloud cost effective for this type of workload?

choices.explanation: The shared security model describes your shared responsibilities with AWS in regards to security.
Performance efficiency is the ability to use computing resources efficiently to meet system requirements.
Your usage is placed on a meter. You pay only when you access it and only for what you use. You pay by the hour or the second for only what you use.
Your usage is placed on a meter. You pay only when you access it and only for what you use. There is not a need for long-term commitments or upfront payments.
Reliability means that a workload will perform its intended function correctly and consistently when it's expected to.

correctAnswers.explanation: Your usage is placed on a meter. You pay only when you access it and only for what you use. You pay by the hour or the second for only what you use.
Your usage is placed on a meter. You pay only when you access it and only for what you use. There is not a need for long-term commitments or upfront payments.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Performance efficiency is the ability to use computing resources efficiently to meet system requirements.

questions.questionText: A company has developed a new web application that uses Amazon RDS MySQL as the backend database. The company wants to ensure the application is highly available. Which feature of RDS can ensure high availability?

choices.text: Using Trusted Advisor to check for resource bottlenecks
choices.explanation: Trusted Advisor checks for database instances that are deployed in a single Availability Zone and alerts you.

choices.text: Using CloudFront to ensure the data is available globally
choices.explanation: CloudFront speeds up distributions of static or dynamic web content to users.

choices.text: Using CloudWatch to monitor the uptime of the application
choices.explanation: Monitoring doesn't ensure high availability, but it can alert you about issues.
RDS provides high availability and failover support for databases when using Multi-AZ deployments.

correctAnswers.explanation: RDS provides high availability and failover support for databases when using Multi-AZ deployments.

questions.questionText: Which of the following statements are true about who can use IAM roles?

choices.text: An IAM user in a different AWS account than the role.
choices.explanation:
A role can be used by either an IAM user in the same AWS account as the role or a user in a different AWS account. A role can also be used by a web service that AWS offers; a prime example is Amazon EC2.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_terms-and-concepts.html

choices.text: An IAM user in the same AWS account as the role.
choices.explanation:
A role can be used by either an IAM user in the same AWS account as the role or a user in a different AWS account. A role can also be used by a web service that AWS offers; a prime example is Amazon EC2.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_terms-and-concepts.html

choices.text: A web service offered by AWS.
choices.explanation:
A role can be used by either an IAM user in the same AWS account as the role or a user in a different AWS account. A role can also be used by a web service that AWS offers; a prime example is Amazon EC2.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_terms-and-concepts.html

choices.text: A web service offered by providers other than AWS.
choices.explanation: A role can be used by either an IAM user in the same AWS account as the role or a user in a different AWS account.

correctAnswers.text: An IAM user in a different AWS account than the role.
correctAnswers.explanation:
A role can be used by either an IAM user in the same AWS account as the role or a user in a different AWS account. A role can also be used by a web service that AWS offers; a prime example is Amazon EC2.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_terms-and-concepts.html

correctAnswers.text: An IAM user in the same AWS account as the role.
correctAnswers.explanation:
A role can be used by either an IAM user in the same AWS account as the role or a user in a different AWS account. A role can also be used by a web service that AWS offers; a prime example is Amazon EC2.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_terms-and-concepts.html

correctAnswers.text: A web service offered by AWS.
correctAnswers.explanation:
A role can be used by either an IAM user in the same AWS account as the role or a user in a different AWS account. A role can also be used by a web service that AWS offers; a prime example is Amazon EC2.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_terms-and-concepts.html

questions.questionText: What is the time that passes between a user request and the resulting response called?

choices.explanation: Latency is the time that passes between a user request and the resulting response.

Availability, more specifically high availability, refers to systems are designed to operate continuously without failure for a long time. These systems avoid loss of service by reducing or managing failures.
Durability is all about long-term data protection. This means your data will remain intact without corruption.
The cloud gives you increased agility. All the services you have access to help you innovate faster, giving you speed to market.

correctAnswers.explanation: Latency is the time that passes between a user request and the resulting response.

questions.questionText: Instead of relying on a single data center to provide its services across the world, AWS relies on several separate geographic areas, each of which consists of one or more isolated locations. What are the official names for these separate geographic areas, and what is the name for the one or more multiple, isolated locations?

choices.explanation: Regions describe the physical locations and Availability Zones group data centers.
Regions describe the physical locations and Availability Zones group data centers.

The separate geographic areas, from which AWS provides its services, are known as Regions. Each Region consists of multiple isolated locations called Availability Zones.  Each Availability Zone has one or more data centers.
[Global Infrastructures Regions and AZs](https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/)https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/
Regions describe the physical locations and Availability Zones group data centers.

correctAnswers.explanation:
The separate geographic areas, from which AWS provides its services, are known as Regions. Each Region consists of multiple isolated locations called Availability Zones.  Each Availability Zone has one or more data centers.
[Global Infrastructures Regions and AZs](https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/)https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/

questions.questionText: Which of the following is AWS responsible for in the Shared Responsibility Model?

choices.explanation:
AWS manages security of the Cloud. This includes the infrastructure, which consists of Regions, edge locations, and Availability Zones. On the other hand, security in the Cloud is the responsibility of the customer. Therefore, AWS is not responsible for safeguarding customer data — the customer is.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/
This is your responsibility.

AWS manages security of the Cloud. This includes the infrastructure, which consists of Regions, edge locations, and Availability Zones. On the other hand, security in the Cloud is the responsibility of the customer. Therefore, AWS is not responsible for safeguarding customer data — the customer is.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

AWS manages security of the Cloud. This includes the infrastructure, which consists of Regions, edge locations, and Availability Zones. On the other hand, security in the Cloud is the responsibility of the customer. Therefore, AWS is not responsible for safeguarding customer data — the customer is.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

correctAnswers.explanation:
AWS manages security of the Cloud. This includes the infrastructure, which consists of Regions, edge locations, and Availability Zones. On the other hand, security in the Cloud is the responsibility of the customer. Therefore, AWS is not responsible for safeguarding customer data — the customer is.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

questions.questionText: A company is migrating to the AWS Cloud. They need to set up DNS in the cloud. Which service is a highly available and scalable cloud DNS service in AWS?

choices.explanation:
DNS will certainly interact with resources in your VPC, but VPC itself does not provide DNS services.
https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/

Route 53 is a DNS service that routes users to applications.
https://aws.amazon.com/route53/

CloudFront is a CDN that delivers data and applications globally with low latency.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudfront/

Macie helps you discover and protect sensitive data on S3.
https://aws.amazon.com/macie/

correctAnswers.explanation:
Route 53 is a DNS service that routes users to applications.
https://aws.amazon.com/route53/

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation:
DNS will certainly interact with resources in your VPC, but VPC itself does not provide DNS services.
https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/

questions.questionText: Which of the following are advantages of cloud computing?

choices.text: You can trade variable expense for capital expense.
choices.explanation: An advantage of cloud computing is to trade capital expense for variable expense.

choices.text: You can increase speed and agility.
choices.explanation: The provided services allow you to innovate more quickly and deliver your applications faster.

choices.text: You can go global in minutes.
choices.explanation: You can deploy your applications around the world at the click of a button.
Your capacity is matched exactly to your demand.

correctAnswers.text: You can increase speed and agility.
correctAnswers.explanation: The provided services allow you to innovate more quickly and deliver your applications faster.

correctAnswers.text: You can go global in minutes.
correctAnswers.explanation: You can deploy your applications around the world at the click of a button.
Your capacity is matched exactly to your demand.

questions.questionText: An EC2 instance in your VPC needs which of the following for the internet gateway to route its traffic to the internet?

choices.explanation:
An EC2 instance in your VPC needs a public IP address for the internet gateway to route its traffic to the internet.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/using-instance-addressing.html
CNAME is a type of DNS record used by Route 53.
A (or Alias) record is a type of DNS record used by Route 53.
Private IP addresses are not accessible from the internet.

correctAnswers.explanation:
An EC2 instance in your VPC needs a public IP address for the internet gateway to route its traffic to the internet.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/using-instance-addressing.html

questions.questionText: What type of long-term credentials for IAM users can be used to sign programmatic requests to the AWS CLI or AWS API (directly or using the AWS SDK)?

choices.explanation: Access keys are long-term credentials for an IAM user or the AWS account root user. You can use access keys to sign programmatic requests to the AWS CLI or AWS API (directly or using the AWS SDK). Access keys consist of two parts: an access key ID (for example, AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE) and a secret access key (for example, wJalrXUtnFEMI/K7MDENG/bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY). Like a user name and password, you must use both the access key ID and secret access key together to authenticate your requests. [Managing access keys for IAM users](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_access-keys.html).
It is never a good idea to pass around root credentials.
A username and password will authenticate a user to gain access to the AWS Management Console, but is not used to authenticate from the command line.

Security tokens provide limited, short-term access for IAM users or federated (outside) users.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/STS/latest/APIReference/welcome.html

correctAnswers.explanation: Access keys are long-term credentials for an IAM user or the AWS account root user. You can use access keys to sign programmatic requests to the AWS CLI or AWS API (directly or using the AWS SDK). Access keys consist of two parts: an access key ID (for example, AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE) and a secret access key (for example, wJalrXUtnFEMI/K7MDENG/bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY). Like a user name and password, you must use both the access key ID and secret access key together to authenticate your requests. [Managing access keys for IAM users](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_access-keys.html).

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: A username and password will authenticate a user to gain access to the AWS Management Console, but is not used to authenticate from the command line.

questions.questionText: How does AWS Shield Standard help protect your environment?

choices.explanation:
AWS Shield Standard is included at no extra cost, but will only block DDoS attacks on your AWS resources. It will not scan the contents of incoming or outgoing traffic (this is a function of WAF) and will not protect your environment from viruses.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/waf/latest/developerguide/shield-chapter.html

choices.text: By scanning incoming application traffic for known attacks.
choices.explanation: Shield will not scan the contents of incoming or outgoing traffic (this is a function of WAF) and will not protect your environment from viruses.

choices.text: By scanning your instances for viruses.
choices.explanation: Shield will not scan the contents of incoming or outgoing traffic (this is a function of WAF) and will not protect your environment from viruses.

choices.text: By scanning outgoing application traffic for sensitive information.
choices.explanation: Shield will not scan the contents of incoming or outgoing traffic (this is a function of WAF) and will not protect your environment from viruses.

correctAnswers.explanation:
AWS Shield Standard is included at no extra cost, but will only block DDoS attacks on your AWS resources. It will not scan the contents of incoming or outgoing traffic (this is a function of WAF) and will not protect your environment from viruses.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/waf/latest/developerguide/shield-chapter.html

incorrectSelectedAnswers.text: By scanning incoming application traffic for known attacks.
incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Shield will not scan the contents of incoming or outgoing traffic (this is a function of WAF) and will not protect your environment from viruses.

questions.questionText: A customer has a complex multi-resource application environment containing multiple EC2 instances, load balancers, S3 buckets, and more. They'd like to provision these resources in an automated and repeatable manner from environment to environment using Infrastructure as Code (IaC). Which service achieves this?

choices.explanation: CloudFormation allows you to provision AWS resources using Infrastructure as Code (IaC). CloudFormation provides a repeatable process for provisioning resources like instances, load balancers, and S3 buckets.
AWS Support does not allow cases for code development, debugging custom software, or performing system administration tasks.
While resources can be provisioned using the AWS CLI, the process is manual and becomes harder to reproduce without error the more resources you have.
While resources can be provisioned using the AWS Management Console, the process is manual and becomes harder to reproduce without error the more resources you have.

correctAnswers.explanation: CloudFormation allows you to provision AWS resources using Infrastructure as Code (IaC). CloudFormation provides a repeatable process for provisioning resources like instances, load balancers, and S3 buckets.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are storage services?

choices.explanation: S3 is a storage service.
RDS is a database service.
VPC is a networking service.
EFS is a storage service.

correctAnswers.explanation: S3 is a storage service.
EFS is a storage service.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is AWS' event-driven, serverless compute service?

choices.explanation:
Lambda is AWS' event-driven, serverless compute service that allows you to run code without having to deploy or manage any of the underlying resources such as EC2 instances.
https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/
EC2 allows you to rent and manage virtual servers in the cloud.
Lightsail allows you to quickly launch all the resources you need for small projects.
Elastic Beanstalk allows you to deploy your web applications and web services to AWS.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Lambda is AWS' event-driven, serverless compute service that allows you to run code without having to deploy or manage any of the underlying resources such as EC2 instances.
https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/

questions.questionText: Which factors are required to sign in to the AWS Management Console using multi-factor authentication (MFA)?

choices.explanation: Multi-Factor Authentication, or MFA, requires 2 factors in order to sign in. In this case, you will need a username/password combination and an authentication code.

Multi-Factor Authentication, or MFA, adds an extra layer of protection to your username and password when logging in to the AWS Management Console. To sign in, you would need 2 factors: 1) the user name and password; and 2) an authentication code from an AWS-supported MFA software app.
https://aws.amazon.com/iam/features/mfa/
Multi-Factor Authentication, or MFA, requires 2 factors in order to sign in. In this case, you will need a username/password combination and an authentication code.
Multi-Factor Authentication, or MFA, requires 2 factors in order to sign in. In this case, you will need a username/password combination and an authentication code.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Multi-Factor Authentication, or MFA, adds an extra layer of protection to your username and password when logging in to the AWS Management Console. To sign in, you would need 2 factors: 1) the user name and password; and 2) an authentication code from an AWS-supported MFA software app.
https://aws.amazon.com/iam/features/mfa/

questions.questionText: A company is planning for increased sales and traffic during an upcoming holiday sale. How can the company BEST prepare to meet the upcoming change in demand?

choices.text: Review traffic from the previous year's sale and add additional instances to match the capacity used.
choices.explanation: There is no guarantee that the needed capacity will be the same this year.
While caching using ElastiCache can boost application performance, it's not the best way to meet unknown capacity demands.

choices.text: Develop a page to display, when demand can't be met, asking the customer to try again later.
choices.explanation: This is not a good solution because there is no guarantee the customer will return to make the purchase.
Auto Scaling adds or removes EC2 instances based on demand.

correctAnswers.explanation: Auto Scaling adds or removes EC2 instances based on demand.

questions.questionText: The AWS global infrastructure includes Regions, Availability Zones, and edge locations. Which best describes the relationship between the infrastructure components?

choices.text: There are more Regions than Availability Zones.
choices.explanation: There are more Availability Zones than Regions.

choices.text: There are more Regions than edge locations.
choices.explanation: There are more edge locations than Regions.

choices.text: There are more edge locations than Regions.
choices.explanation: There are more edge locations than Regions.

choices.text: There are more Availability Zones than edge locations.
choices.explanation: There are more edge locations than Availability Zones.

choices.text: There are more Availability Zones than Regions
choices.explanation: There are more Availability Zones than Regions.

correctAnswers.text: There are more edge locations than Regions.
correctAnswers.explanation: There are more edge locations than Regions.

correctAnswers.text: There are more Availability Zones than Regions
correctAnswers.explanation: There are more Availability Zones than Regions.

questions.questionText: A new application needs temporary access to resources in AWS. How can this best be achieved?

choices.text: Add the application to a group that has the appropriate permissions.
choices.explanation: Applications cannot be added to IAM groups.

choices.text: Store an access key in an S3 bucket and give the application access to the bucket.
choices.explanation: It would need to be a user who uses the access keys. Additionally, access keys are typically for longer-term access.

choices.text: Create an IAM role and have the application assume the role.
choices.explanation:
Roles define access permissions and are temporarily assumed by an IAM user or service.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_use_switch-role-ec2.html

choices.text: Create an IAM policy and attach it to the application.
choices.explanation: A policy cannot be attached directly to an application. A policy can be attached to a role, and the application could assume the role.

correctAnswers.text: Create an IAM role and have the application assume the role.
correctAnswers.explanation:
Roles define access permissions and are temporarily assumed by an IAM user or service.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_use_switch-role-ec2.html

incorrectSelectedAnswers.text: Store an access key in an S3 bucket and give the application access to the bucket.
incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: It would need to be a user who uses the access keys. Additionally, access keys are typically for longer-term access.

questions.questionText: A healthcare agency needs to store certain patient information for up to 10 years. To save cost, they want to archive this data to cheaper storage. The data needs to be retrieved within 12 hours. Which is the cheapest option?

choices.explanation:
Glacier Deep Archive meets the requirement and is the cheapest option.
https://aws.amazon.com/glacier/

choices.text: Amazon S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval (Formerly S3 Glacier)
choices.explanation:
Amazon S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval (Formerly S3 Glacier) meets the requirements provided in the scenario, but it is not the cheapest option.
https://aws.amazon.com/glacier/

Redshift is for data warehousing and is not a proper service for this scenario.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/mgmt/welcome.html

S3 Standard-IA is not the cheapest option, due in large part by its ability to retrieve data very rapidly.
https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/

correctAnswers.explanation:
Glacier Deep Archive meets the requirement and is the cheapest option.
https://aws.amazon.com/glacier/

questions.questionText: Which of the following are a collection of data centers within a specific Region?

choices.explanation: Edge locations cache content for fast delivery to your users.
A Region is a physical location. AWS logically groups its Regions into geographic locations.
This is related to CloudFront. An origin is a location where content is stored.

Availability Zones are a collection of data centers within a specific region.
[AWS Global Infrastructure](https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/)

correctAnswers.explanation:
Availability Zones are a collection of data centers within a specific region.
[AWS Global Infrastructure](https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/)

questions.questionText: Which of the following can you host on S3?

choices.explanation: Websites that are dynamic or require code to run on the server side cannot be hosted on solely on S3.

S3 can be used to host simple static websites - other types that are dynamic or require code to run on the server side cannot be hosted on solely on S3.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/gsg/S3-gsg-CommonUseScenarios.html
Websites that are dynamic or require code to run on the server side cannot be hosted on solely on S3.
Websites that are dynamic or require code to run on the server side cannot be hosted on solely on S3.

correctAnswers.explanation:
S3 can be used to host simple static websites - other types that are dynamic or require code to run on the server side cannot be hosted on solely on S3.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/gsg/S3-gsg-CommonUseScenarios.html

questions.questionText: Which of the following best describes an AWS Region?

choices.text: A distinct location within a geographic area designed to provide high availability to a specific geography
choices.explanation:
A Region is a distinct location within a geographic area designed to provide high availability to a specific geography. Regions are a key concept in AWS' Global Infrastructure — each is made up of 1 or more isolated (within that Region) Availability Zones. There are often multiple AWS Regions on each continent, such as North America.
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/

choices.text: A collection of data centers that are spread evenly around a specific continent
choices.explanation: An Availability Zone is a collection of data centers. A Region is a collection of Availability Zones.

choices.text: A console that gives you a quick, global picture of your cloud computing environment
choices.explanation: This describes the AWS Management Console, not a Region.

choices.text: A collection of databases that can only be accessed from a specific geographic region
choices.explanation: While databases are deployed to a data center in an Availability Zone in a particular Region, this does not describe a Region.

correctAnswers.text: A distinct location within a geographic area designed to provide high availability to a specific geography
correctAnswers.explanation:
A Region is a distinct location within a geographic area designed to provide high availability to a specific geography. Regions are a key concept in AWS' Global Infrastructure — each is made up of 1 or more isolated (within that Region) Availability Zones. There are often multiple AWS Regions on each continent, such as North America.
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/

questions.questionText: You are creating a few IAM policies. This is the first time you have worked with IAM policies. Which tool can you use to test IAM policies?

choices.explanation:
The IAM policy simulator allows you to test and troubleshoot identity-based policies, IAM permissions boundaries, service control policies (SCPs), and resource-based policies.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/access_policies_testing-policies.html

CloudWatch will not provide any kind of examination of IAM policies. CloudWatch is a collection of services that help you monitor and observe your cloud resources.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/

GuardDuty is an intelligent threat detection system that uncovers unauthorized behavior. GuardDuty does not provide a testing mechanism for IAM policies.
https://aws.amazon.com/guardduty/

Inspector works with EC2 instances to uncover and report vulnerabilities. Amazon Inspector actually examines your applications and looks for security vulnerabilities, but it cannot examine individual policies.
https://aws.amazon.com/inspector/

correctAnswers.explanation:
The IAM policy simulator allows you to test and troubleshoot identity-based policies, IAM permissions boundaries, service control policies (SCPs), and resource-based policies.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/access_policies_testing-policies.html

questions.questionText: A company is running several Linux workloads in the cloud. They are considering storage options. Which storage option should the company NOT use due to the fact the data will be lost when the instance is stopped or terminated?

choices.explanation: An instance store is a local storage that is physically attached to the host computer and cannot be removed. Storage is temporary since data loss occurs when the EC2 instance is stopped.
You can easily connect to your S3 buckets from your EC2 instances, as long as the proper permissions are in place.
EBS is a storage device (called a volume) that can be attached to (or removed from) your instance.
EFS is a serverless network file system for sharing files that support Linux-based workloads.

correctAnswers.explanation: An instance store is a local storage that is physically attached to the host computer and cannot be removed. Storage is temporary since data loss occurs when the EC2 instance is stopped.

questions.questionText: Which of the following AWS services is a fast, fully managed data warehouse that makes it simple and cost-effective to analyze all your data using standard SQL and your existing business intelligence tools.

choices.explanation: Kinesis allows you to analyze data and video streams in real time.
DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL key-value and document database.

Redshift is AWS' fully managed data warehouse solution.

https://aws.amazon.com/redshift/
EMR helps you process large amounts of data.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Redshift is AWS' fully managed data warehouse solution.

https://aws.amazon.com/redshift/

questions.questionText: A customer would like to use machine learning to uncover the meaning and relationships in text from customer support incidents to ensure customers are happy after speaking to a support agent. How can they process the text from customer support incidents?

choices.explanation: Macie uses machine learning to discover sensitive data stored on Amazon S3. Macie automatically detects a large and growing list of sensitive data types, including personally identifiable information (PII) such as names, addresses, and credit card numbers.
SNS is a notification service that allows you to send text messages and emails.
Comprehend is a natural language processing (NLP) service that uses machine learning to discover relationships and insights in text.

Amazon Connect allows you to build a cloud contact center and provide customer service at a lower cost. We didn't officially cover Connect, but you may see a few service names on the exam that we didn't fully explore. Please make sure you read the ["Overview of Amazon Web Services" whitepaper](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/aws-overview.pdf) before the exam.

correctAnswers.explanation: Comprehend is a natural language processing (NLP) service that uses machine learning to discover relationships and insights in text.

questions.questionText: How can new AWS users easily search for and find services in their AWS accounts?

choices.explanation: The AWS CLI allows you to access your AWS account through a terminal or command window. If you're new to AWS, this is not an easy way to search and find services in your AWS account.
Application code is a form of programmatic access and is not an easy way to search and find services in your AWS account.
The console makes it easy to search for and find services.
SDKs are a form of programmatic access and uploaded: are not easy ways to search and find services in your AWS account.

correctAnswers.explanation: The console makes it easy to search for and find services.

questions.questionText: Which of the following support plans features a < 4-hour response time in the event of an impaired production system?

choices.explanation: Individual is not a support plan provided by AWS Support.
Both the Business and Enterprise support levels offer a < 4-hour response time in the event of an impaired production system.
Basic does not offer any support for system impairment.
Developer is < 12-hour response time in the event of any system impairment.

correctAnswers.explanation: Both the Business and Enterprise support levels offer a < 4-hour response time in the event of an impaired production system.

questions.questionText: In Identity and Access Management (IAM), which term applies to a person or application that uses the AWS account root user, an IAM user, or an IAM role to sign in and make requests to AWS?

choices.explanation: Entities are the IAM resource objects that AWS uses for authentication. These include IAM users, federated users, and assumed IAM roles.
Resources are the user, group, role, policy, and identity provider objects that are stored in IAM. As with other AWS services, you can add, edit, and remove resources from IAM.
A principal is a person or application that uses the AWS account root user, an IAM user, or an IAM role to sign in and make requests to AWS.
Identities are the IAM resource objects that are used to identify and group. You can attach a policy to an IAM identity. These include users, groups, and roles.

correctAnswers.explanation: A principal is a person or application that uses the AWS account root user, an IAM user, or an IAM role to sign in and make requests to AWS.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Identities are the IAM resource objects that are used to identify and group. You can attach a policy to an IAM identity. These include users, groups, and roles.

questions.questionText: VMware Cloud on AWS allows companies to migrate and extend their on-premises VMware vSphere-based environments to AWS Cloud using Amazon EC2. Which of the following choices accurately classifies this deployment model?

choices.explanation:
Hybrid deployments connect infrastructure and applications between cloud-based resources and existing resources that are not located in the cloud. VMware Cloud on AWS is an example of a hybrid deployment, since it involves the on-premises environments of VMware and the cloud-based services of AWS.
https://aws.amazon.com/hybrid/
Cloud is not 1 of the cloud deployment models.
Shared services is not 1 of the cloud deployment models.
On-premises defines workloads that run in an internal data center.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Hybrid deployments connect infrastructure and applications between cloud-based resources and existing resources that are not located in the cloud. VMware Cloud on AWS is an example of a hybrid deployment, since it involves the on-premises environments of VMware and the cloud-based services of AWS.
https://aws.amazon.com/hybrid/

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Cloud is not 1 of the cloud deployment models.

questions.questionText: AWS Trusted Advisor provides checks and recommended actions. Which of the following is not one of those checks?

choices.explanation:
This is a check performed in Trusted Advisor.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/technology/trusted-advisor/

choices.text: Unrestricted access for specific ports on EC2
choices.explanation:
This is a check performed in Trusted Advisor.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/technology/trusted-advisor/

choices.text: Checks for usage more than 80% of the service limit
choices.explanation:
This is a check performed in Trusted Advisor.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/technology/trusted-advisor/

choices.text: Checks to determine if an administrative user is used instead of the root account
choices.explanation: This is not a check provided in Trusted Advisor.

correctAnswers.text: Checks to determine if an administrative user is used instead of the root account
correctAnswers.explanation: This is not a check provided in Trusted Advisor.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.text: Checks for usage more than 80% of the service limit
incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation:
This is a check performed in Trusted Advisor.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/technology/trusted-advisor/

questions.questionText: A healthcare company has nightly batch jobs that can afford to be interrupted. Which EC2 pricing model can meet this need and provide great savings by using a supply-and-demand model?

choices.explanation: These instances are for longer-term contracts. Nothing in the scenario suggests long term.
With On-Demand Instances, you pay for compute capacity by the second with no long-term commitments. But this is 1 of the more expensive options.

EC2 Spot Instances let you take advantage of unused EC2 capacity in the AWS Cloud. Spot Instances are available at up to a 90% discount compared to On-Demand prices.
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/spot/

Standard Reserved Instances provide you with a significant discount (up to 72%) compared to On-Demand Instance pricing and can be purchased for a 1-year or 3-year term. However, there is still a cheaper option.

correctAnswers.explanation:
EC2 Spot Instances let you take advantage of unused EC2 capacity in the AWS Cloud. Spot Instances are available at up to a 90% discount compared to On-Demand prices.
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/spot/

questions.questionText: Broadly speaking, AWS is responsible for:

choices.text: No security — security is up to the customer to manage
choices.explanation: Security is a shared responsibility.
This is your responsibility.

Generally speaking, AWS is responsible for security OF the Cloud — meaning that it is responsible for the infrastructure (hardware and software) which is used to deliver Cloud services to customers.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

choices.text: Security both IN and OF the Cloud
choices.explanation: This is a shared responsibility.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Generally speaking, AWS is responsible for security OF the Cloud — meaning that it is responsible for the infrastructure (hardware and software) which is used to deliver Cloud services to customers.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

questions.questionText: If you want access to all AWS Trusted Advisor checks, which of the AWS Support plans will provide that?

choices.explanation: This plan does not provide access to all of the Trusted Advisor checks.
You must choose either the Business or Enterprise support plans to gain access to all AWS Trusted Advisor checks.
You must choose either the Business or Enterprise support plans to gain access to all AWS Trusted Advisor checks.
This plan does not provide access to all of the Trusted Advisor checks.

correctAnswers.explanation: You must choose either the Business or Enterprise support plans to gain access to all AWS Trusted Advisor checks.
You must choose either the Business or Enterprise support plans to gain access to all AWS Trusted Advisor checks.

questions.questionText: Which cloud computing model offers fundamental building blocks that can be rented?

choices.explanation: IaaS offers building blocks that can be rented. EC2 is an example of IaaS.
SaaS allows you to use a complete application on demand.
FaaS allows you to execute code in response to events.
PaaS is often used by developers to develop software using web-based tools.

correctAnswers.explanation: IaaS offers building blocks that can be rented. EC2 is an example of IaaS.

questions.questionText: Which of the following services are available 24x7 for all AWS Support plans?

choices.explanation:
All AWS Support plans provide 24x7 access to customer service, documentation, and support forums.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/
For 24x7 access to Cloud Support Engineers, you will specifically need to get a Business or Enterprise Support plan.

All AWS Support plans provide 24x7 access to customer service, documentation, and support forums.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

All AWS Support plans provide 24x7 access to customer service, documentation, and support forums.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

correctAnswers.explanation:
All AWS Support plans provide 24x7 access to customer service, documentation, and support forums.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

All AWS Support plans provide 24x7 access to customer service, documentation, and support forums.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

All AWS Support plans provide 24x7 access to customer service, documentation, and support forums.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

questions.questionText: Which of the following allows you to access AWS services from popular programming languages like Java, Python, and C#?

choices.explanation: You will need to use an SDK from a programming languge (i.e., application code) to access AWS services.

Software development kits (or SDKs) provide everything you need to develop and manage applications in AWS, including the programming language of your choice.
https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/aws-overview.pdf
The AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) allows you to access your AWS account through a terminal or command window.
The AWS Management Console allows you to access your AWS account and manage applications running in your account from a web browser.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Software development kits (or SDKs) provide everything you need to develop and manage applications in AWS, including the programming language of your choice.
https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/aws-overview.pdf

questions.questionText: Which of the following services will help you optimize your entire AWS environment in real-time following AWS best practices?

choices.explanation: Shield is a managed Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) protection service.

Trusted Advisor helps you optimize your entire AWS environment in real-time following AWS best practices. It helps you optimize cost, fault tolerance, and more.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/trustedadvisor/
Inspector works with EC2 instances to uncover and report vulnerabilities.
WAF helps protect your web applications against common web attacks.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Trusted Advisor helps you optimize your entire AWS environment in real-time following AWS best practices. It helps you optimize cost, fault tolerance, and more.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/trustedadvisor/

questions.questionText: A customer would like the ability to send HTML formatted emails from their application for marketing campaigns. Which service should the customer consider using?

choices.explanation: Amazon SES is an email service that allows you to send richly formatted HTML emails from your applications. It is the ideal choice for marketing campaigns or professional emails. Unlike SNS, SES sends HTML emails.

Amazon SNS is a notification service that allows you to send text messages and emails. It is well suited for scenarios where you need to publish messages to a topic, allowing subscribers to receive the messages.

Lambda is a service that lets you run code without managing servers. While Lambda can integrate with other email services and developers can access email APIs within code, Lambda alone cannot send emails.
Data Pipeline helps you move data between compute and storage services running either on AWS or on-premises.
SQS is a message queuing service that allows you to build loosely coupled systems.

correctAnswers.explanation: Amazon SES is an email service that allows you to send richly formatted HTML emails from your applications. It is the ideal choice for marketing campaigns or professional emails. Unlike SNS, SES sends HTML emails.

questions.questionText: A company is deploying an application to an EC2 instance. They care most about achieving the lowest cost possible and don't mind if their workloads are interrupted. Which pricing option should the company consider?

choices.explanation: Savings Plan allows the customer to commit to compute usage (measured per hour) for 1 or 3 years.
A Reserved Instance allows the customer to commit to a specific instance type in a particular Region for 1 or 3 years.
Spot Instances let you take advantage of unused EC2 capacity and are good for workloads that can be interrupted.
Dedicated Hosts allow the customer to pay for a physical server that is fully dedicated to running their instances.

correctAnswers.explanation: Spot Instances let you take advantage of unused EC2 capacity and are good for workloads that can be interrupted.

questions.questionText: You have a read-heavy application workload resulting in I/O-intensive Amazon RDS database queries. Which service is most suitable to improve performance?

choices.explanation: DynamoDB is a NoSQL database. It will not interact directly with an RDS database in the way needed in this scenario.
Redshift is a Data Warehouse, not to be confused with Redis, which is a version of ElastiCache, which could be used to help in this scenario.

You can use ElastiCache to store the results of often-used queries, and this will allow quicker retrieval of this data.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticache/
DAX can serve a similar function for NoSQL (DynamoDB).

correctAnswers.explanation:
You can use ElastiCache to store the results of often-used queries, and this will allow quicker retrieval of this data.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticache/

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Redshift is a Data Warehouse, not to be confused with Redis, which is a version of ElastiCache, which could be used to help in this scenario.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are advantages of cloud computing?

choices.explanation: The cloud gives you increased agility. All the services you have access to help you innovate faster, giving you speed to market.
You pay for what you use instead of making huge upfront investments.
With elasticity, you do not have to plan ahead of time how much capacity you need. You can provision only what you need, and then grow and shrink based on demand.
You pay for what you use instead of making huge upfront investments.

correctAnswers.explanation: The cloud gives you increased agility. All the services you have access to help you innovate faster, giving you speed to market.
You pay for what you use instead of making huge upfront investments.
With elasticity, you do not have to plan ahead of time how much capacity you need. You can provision only what you need, and then grow and shrink based on demand.

questions.questionText: How does S3 Transfer Acceleration help you get your data into S3 quicker?

choices.text: By splitting up your data into smaller chunks and uploading it simultaneously, then putting it back together on S3
choices.explanation: This is not a feature of S3 Transfer Acceleration.

choices.text: By letting you send the data in on a disk you provide (saving on upload times), then copying it to S3
choices.explanation: This is not a feature of S3 Transfer Acceleration.

choices.text: By compressing your data to make it smaller for upload, then de-compressing it onto S3
choices.explanation: This is not a feature of S3 Transfer Acceleration.

choices.text: By using AWS' network of edge locations to upload to a location closest to you before taking the most optimal path within AWS' network
choices.explanation:
S3 Transfer Acceleration uses AWS' network of edge locations to ingest data, and then uses the most optimal path within its own network to reach S3. Although compression and splitting data up before upload can also help speed things up, these are not offered by Transfer Acceleration. AWS does not let you send in data on your own disks, and although Snowball does let you send data in without going across the internet, it is only useful when working with massive amounts of data.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/transfer-acceleration.html

correctAnswers.text: By using AWS' network of edge locations to upload to a location closest to you before taking the most optimal path within AWS' network
correctAnswers.explanation:
S3 Transfer Acceleration uses AWS' network of edge locations to ingest data, and then uses the most optimal path within its own network to reach S3. Although compression and splitting data up before upload can also help speed things up, these are not offered by Transfer Acceleration. AWS does not let you send in data on your own disks, and although Snowball does let you send data in without going across the internet, it is only useful when working with massive amounts of data.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/transfer-acceleration.html

incorrectSelectedAnswers.text: By splitting up your data into smaller chunks and uploading it simultaneously, then putting it back together on S3
incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: This is not a feature of S3 Transfer Acceleration.

questions.questionText: A company would like to implement a hybrid storage model where they connect on-premises data storage to storage in the AWS Cloud in order to move their backups to the cloud. What is the best and most efficient way to achieve this?

choices.explanation: While Direct Connect supports a hybrid model, it's not the best and most efficient solution.
Storage Gateway is a hybrid storage service that allows you to connect on-premises and cloud data.
While a Site-to-Site VPN supports a hybrid model, it's not the best and most efficient solution.
EFS is a serverless network file system for sharing files and only supports the Linux file system.

correctAnswers.explanation: Storage Gateway is a hybrid storage service that allows you to connect on-premises and cloud data.

questions.questionText: Which services can host a MariaDB database?

choices.explanation: DocumentDB is a fully managed document database that supports MongoDB.
DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL key-value and document database.
RDS supports several popular database engines: Amazon Aurora, PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, Oracle Database, and SQL Server.
Aurora is a relational database compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL that was created by AWS.
For complete control of a database, you can install the database software directly on an EC2 instance.

correctAnswers.explanation: RDS supports several popular database engines: Amazon Aurora, PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, Oracle Database, and SQL Server.
For complete control of a database, you can install the database software directly on an EC2 instance.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Aurora is a relational database compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL that was created by AWS.

questions.questionText: Which security service provides enhanced protections and 24/7 access to AWS experts for a fee when issues arise?

choices.explanation: AWS Shield Standard provides free protection against common and frequently occurring attacks, but doesn't provide 24/7 access to AWS experts.
Macie helps you discover and protect sensitive data.
AWS Shield Advanced provides enhanced protections and 24/7 access to AWS experts for a fee.
An AWS Support plan is not considered a security service.

correctAnswers.explanation: AWS Shield Advanced provides enhanced protections and 24/7 access to AWS experts for a fee.

questions.questionText: Which of the below are you responsible for when running an RDS database on AWS?

choices.explanation: This is a responsibility of AWS.

choices.text: Controlling access to the compute hardware
choices.explanation: This is a responsibility of AWS.

Under the Shared Responsibility Model for managed services, AWS takes responsibility for managing all the hardware (including access, patching, and other maintenance), as well as making sure the underlying OS and application is up-to-date. You as the user are responsible for keeping your data secure.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

choices.text: Controlling access to the network hardware
choices.explanation: This is a responsibility of AWS.
This is a responsibility of AWS.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Under the Shared Responsibility Model for managed services, AWS takes responsibility for managing all the hardware (including access, patching, and other maintenance), as well as making sure the underlying OS and application is up-to-date. You as the user are responsible for keeping your data secure.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

questions.questionText: A company would like to automate the configuration of its servers and deploy code to servers in the cloud and on-premises. Which service meets the requirement?

choices.explanation: OpsWorks allows you to use Chef or Puppet to automate the configuration of your servers and deploy code on-premises or the cloud.
Don't forget Elastic Beanstalk is only used to deploy applications to the AWS Cloud — it is not used to deploy applications on-premises.
CodeBuild allows you to build and test your application source code.
While CodeDeploy can deploy code to the cloud and on-premises, it is not used to automate the configuration of servers like OpsWorks.

correctAnswers.explanation: OpsWorks allows you to use Chef or Puppet to automate the configuration of your servers and deploy code on-premises or the cloud.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: While CodeDeploy can deploy code to the cloud and on-premises, it is not used to automate the configuration of servers like OpsWorks.

questions.questionText: A company would like to understand its total cost of ownership (TCO) when all workloads are moved to the cloud. Which should the company consider in their AWS TCO?

choices.explanation: This should be included in the TCO calculation, as the company will pay for this.
Infrastructure, like servers, are maintained by AWS.
Building security is handled by AWS.
This should be included in the TCO calculation, as the company will pay for this.
This should be included in the TCO calculation, as the company will pay for this.

correctAnswers.explanation: This should be included in the TCO calculation, as the company will pay for this.
This should be included in the TCO calculation, as the company will pay for this.
This should be included in the TCO calculation, as the company will pay for this.
